hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via RSI Divergence at Macro Support
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when BTC approaches the 200-day SMA (within ±3%) while showing bullish RSI divergence (price makes lower low, 14-day RSI makes higher low), and funding rates turn negative extreme (<-0.03% daily), a close above the 20-day EMA with expanding volume signals transition to NEUTRAL regime with 65% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear regimes often exhaust at major moving averages when sentiment reaches extreme fear (funding negative, F&G low). RSI divergence indicates weakening selling momentum. Volume-confirmed break above short-term EMA suggests initial buying interest and potential regime transition.
entry_conditions: Bullish RSI divergence: price lower low vs 10 days ago, 14-day RSI higher low

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price reaches +6% from entry OR regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes below recent swing low (entry signal day low)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 trading days after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 50% of such divergence signals lead to NEUTRAL regime within 10 days OR average return after signal is negative over 5-day horizon.
